claim: Flublok is produced using a novel production platform in which recombinant HA is expressed in insect cells using a baculovirus expression vector system (BEVS).
explanation: Four-panel figure showing geometric mean fold rise (1 month post-vaccination) and waning fold reduction (6 months) of antibody titers against multiple influenza strains (H3N2 egg, H3N2 cell, H1N1 egg, H1N1 cell, B/VIC egg, B/VIC cell, B/YAM egg, B/YAM cell) in adults aged 18–44 and 45–64, comparing four vaccines: Fluzone IIV4 (open circles), Fluarix IIV4 (black circles), cell-culture IIV4 (green circles), and RIV4 (orange circles). P-values for comparisons are annotated above groups. The figure only presents immunogenicity data and vaccine comparisons; it does not describe or mention that Flublok (RIV4) is produced using a baculovirus expression vector system in insect cells, so it does not support the claim. Note: Analysis limited to visible figure content; no text on production platform is present.
